column4: anyone know how to make firefox not make me jump through 5 hoops to see a site with a self signed cert?

maybe you can right-click and add it?  I dunno
nah... it takes 4 or 5 steps regardless.... no amount of right clicking fixes this ;)
no, right-click inside about:config settings list and go "New"
ah, I can see all the settings, none of them seem to pertain to my problem though... (no "allow self signed certs" setting or anything)
dunno.  Maybe try server irc.mozilla.org channel #firefox
lame...  I guess I can d/l the source and try "fixing" it myself... lol perhaps a fork is in order
there is an excellent reason why the new default is as it is.

basically, when Alice uses encryption to send a message to Bob, that usually makes sure only Bob can read it.  but if Bob uses a self-signed cert, then Alice doesn't know if Bob is the real Bob or an imposter.  But self-signed certs cause newbie users to see a lock.  So they think it's guaranteed they are talking to Bob.  Bad.  Makes sense?
was my message clipped in the middle?
I'm not really concerned about any of that honestly.  It's more a matter of "this should be optional"
I  mean, I get it, don't get me wrong.  I'm a developer, I do encryption software... I don't need a nanny though
but then some well-meaning "experts" will set their grandparents' PCs to accept self-signed certs as gold
that's their business
that actually hurts the grandparents.
sorry, freedom is far more important than security
always has been
always will be
that is why firefox lets you fork it :)
